messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] tofu, melted choco chips
messages.msgSnippet: Noemi!! Hello!   We ve been so busy, but I ve missed you! Is there an address in Brazil where Aya may receive a package?   We have a PILE of things to send
messages.messageBody:
Noemi!!

Hello! We've been so busy, but I've missed you!
Is there an address in Brazil where Aya may receive a package? We have
a PILE of things to send her!

Sorry I lost the tofu / chocolate chip post, I can't help. But it sounds
wonderful, doesn't it?

I would love to hear what you've been doing.

Love & Peace,

Deb


On Thu, 9 Jan 2003 22:41:46 +0900 "noemi hiraishi" <noeminh@...>
writes:
> I am eager to try blending tofu with "melted choco chips". What
> is it? I am Brazilian and live in Tokyo. (Hi Deb! Sorry, for
> the absence. Tuesday we are going to Brazil again.) Do you melt
> any chocolate or am I supposed to melt choco chips and then blend
> it with the tofu. ? Sorry for my ignorance.
>
> As for the tofu steak, we here prefer to have some some
> cornstarch or white flour around the tofu before frying it on the
> pan with olive oil and garlic. Ups, first I wrap them in kitchen
> paper and microwave for 3 min at 500w. then, flavor with black
> pepper and salt.
>
> Happy new year to you all!

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] tofu, melted choco chips
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/9/2003 7:28:11 AM Central Standard Time, noeminh@gol.com ... I bet butterscotch chips or peanut butter chips would work too.  Hmmm......
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/9/2003 7:28:11 AM Central Standard Time, noeminh@...
writes:


> Do you melt
> any chocolate or am I supposed to melt choco chips and then blend
> it with the tofu. ? Sorry for my ignorance.
>
> Yes, melt the chocolate chips and add to the blended tofu. Blend it in
> your blender and don't use a hand mixer. It doesn't work and you waste
> perfectly good chocolate!


I bet butterscotch chips or peanut butter chips would work too. Hmmm......
Oh, yeah fresh fruit that would probably be good too! :)

Joy

messages.subject: tofu, melted choco chips
messages.msgSnippet: I am eager to try blending tofu with melted choco chips .  What is it?  I am Brazilian and live in Tokyo. (Hi Deb!   Sorry, for the absence.  Tuesday we are
messages.messageBody:
I am eager to try blending tofu with "melted choco chips". What
is it? I am Brazilian and live in Tokyo. (Hi Deb! Sorry, for
the absence. Tuesday we are going to Brazil again.) Do you melt
any chocolate or am I supposed to melt choco chips and then blend
it with the tofu. ? Sorry for my ignorance.

As for the tofu steak, we here prefer to have some some
cornstarch or white flour around the tofu before frying it on the
pan with olive oil and garlic. Ups, first I wrap them in kitchen
paper and microwave for 3 min at 500w. then, flavor with black
pepper and salt.

Happy new year to you all!
